TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ChoiceFormat extends Java.Text.NumberFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a fixed string based on a numeric value.

remarks.para: Returns a fixed string based on a numeric value. The class can be used in conjunction with the class to handle plurals in messages. ChoiceFormat enables users to attach a format to a range of numbers. The choice is specified with an ascending list of doubles, where each item specifies a half-open interval up to the next item as in the following: X matches j if and only if limit[j] <= X .
ChoiceFormat.nextDouble(double) allows to get the double following the one passed to the method. This is used to create half open intervals.

ChoiceFormat objects also may be converted to and from patterns. The conversion can be done programmatically, as in the example above, or by using a pattern like the following:
"1#Sun|2#Mon|3#Tue|4#Wed|5#Thur|6#Fri|7#Sat" "0#are no files|1#is one file|1<are many files"

Docs.summary: Constructs a new ChoiceFormat with the strings and limits parsed from the specified pattern.

MemberSignature.Value: public ChoiceFormat (double[] limits, string[] formats);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64[] limits, string[] formats) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a new ChoiceFormat with the specified double values and associated strings.

remarks.para: Constructs a new ChoiceFormat with the specified double values and associated strings. When calling with a double value d, then the element i in formats is selected where i fulfills limits[i] <= d .
The length of the limits and formats arrays must be the same.

Docs.param: true to get the next larger value, false to get the previous smaller value.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Java.Lang.Number Parse (string string, Java.Text.ParsePosition position);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Lang.Number Parse(string string, class Java.Text.ParsePosition position) cil managed

Docs.param: input/output parameter, specifies the start index in string from where to start parsing. See the Returns section for a description of the output values.
Docs.summary: Parses a double from the specified string starting at the index specified by position.

remarks.para: Parses a double from the specified string starting at the index specified by position. The string is compared to the strings of this ChoiceFormat and if a match occurs then the lower bound of the corresponding range in the limits array is returned. If the string is successfully parsed then the index of the ParsePosition passed to this method is updated to the index following the parsed text.

remarks.para: Equivalent to with direction == Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetChoices(float64[] limits, string[] formats) cil managed

Docs.param: an array of doubles in ascending order. The lowest and highest possible values are negative and positive infinity.
the strings associated with the ranges defined through limits. The lower bound of the associated range is at the same index as the string.
Docs.summary: Sets the double values and associated strings of this ChoiceFormat.

remarks.para: Sets the double values and associated strings of this ChoiceFormat. When calling with a double value d, then the element i in formats is selected where i fulfills limits[i] <= d .
The length of the limits and formats arrays must be the same.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
